title: CANCELED | Lecture: Charles Atlas
hero_caption: Charles Atlas. Still from Here she is . . . v1, 2015. Audio: You Were the One, written and performed by Lady Bunny. © Charles Atlas; Courtesy of the artist and Luhring Augustine, New York.
short_description: Charles Atlas (American, born 1949) has been a pioneering figure in film and video for over four decades. Atlas has extended the limits of his medium, forging new territory in a far-reaching range of genres, stylistic approaches, and techniques. Throughout his career, the artist has consistently fostered collaborative relationships, working intimately with such artists and performers as Leigh Bowery, Michael Clark, Douglas Dunn, Marina Abramovic, Yvonne Rainer, Mika Tajima/New Humans, and Antony and the Johnsons. Most notably Atlas served as Merce Cunningham's in-house videographer for a decade from the early 1970s through 1983, and their close working relationship continued until Cunningham’s death in 2009.
description:
In the interest of the health and safety of our visitors, guest speakers, performers, and staff, we are canceling all events through May 10.

Please review other precautionary measures the museum is taking due to COVID-19.

Charles Atlas (American, born 1949) has been a pioneering figure in film and video for over four decades. Atlas has extended the limits of his medium, forging new territory in a far-reaching range of genres, stylistic approaches, and techniques. Throughout his career, the artist has consistently fostered collaborative relationships, working intimately with such artists and performers as Leigh Bowery, Michael Clark, Douglas Dunn, Marina Abramovic, Yvonne Rainer, Mika Tajima/New Humans, and Antony and the Johnsons. Most notably Atlas served as Merce Cunningham's in-house videographer for a decade from the early 1970s through 1983, and their close working relationship continued until Cunningham’s death in 2009.

Presented by the Society for Contemporary Art
